unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explain the importance of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander epistemologies.
Demonstrate an understanding of the importance of working with local Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community.
Demonstrate the confidence to teach Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander perspectives without concern.
Implement strategies for teaching Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students.
Embed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander histories and cultures in primary and secondary classrooms.

assessments.description: Consider the socio-political, curricular and pedagogical implications when incorporating Indigenous resources through a written essay and video-blog.

Students to consider their positionality in relation to western knowledge systems and develop an understanding of ontologies, epistemologies, and the impact these have on education and knowledge creation.

data.subject_search_title: EDUC3880 - Aboriginal Education Issues and Approaches
data.description: This unit is designed to develop students' knowledge and understanding of those issues impacting the delivery of Indigenous education in Australia. Invasion and colonisation, the effects of government policies, the stolen generations, and the developing relationship between Indigenous and non-Indigenous Australians are explored in the context of learning and teaching in the classroom. Approaches for teaching Indigenous students are explored, along with the requirement to include Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander histories and cultures across the curriculum. Aboriginal people involved in education introduce many of these issues. The unit aims to create a learning environment where students can gain confidence in how they talk about Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
